Pre-Game Insights: The Toronto Blue Jays will try to sweep a three-game series with a victory against the St. Louis Cardinals.
Toronto has a 37-37 record in home games and a 71-78 record overall.
Blue Jays hitters have a collective.314 on-base percentage, the sixth-ranked percentage in the AL.
St. Louis is 35-39 on the road and 74-74 overall.
The Cardinals have the seventh-ranked team batting average in the NL at.246.
This will be the third time these teams have squared off this season.
